fields.headline: The Rocker
fields.bodyText: Here is a high-concept comedy, indebted to Jack Black's School of Rock, which looked promising. Somehow, though, there weren't as many funny lines as there should have been. Rainn Wilson (from the US version of The Office) plays Fish, a drummer with a heavy-metal band who was humiliatingly fired from the group in the 1980s. Twenty years later, an embittered Fish is working in a call centre, living with his married sister and dreaming of what might have been. His sister's son and his friends have formed a whingeing, indie band called ADD, and need a drummer, so ageing badass Uncle Fish gets the job, somehow energises the band and gets them breathtakingly close to rock'n'roll stardom - at which point disaster strikes. It all looks good and there's a decent cast but nothing really takes off.
